page.title: 16AN ETTRICK FARMER'S WINTER.
page.content: Ettrick Valley is very cold in Winter and very hot in Summer.In Winter the valley turns white with snow and the snow on the hills drifts.The farmer has to feed the sheep because there is not enough grass for them all and if they don't get enough they can't make milk for the lambs when they are born.As well as the sheep the farmer has to feed the hill cows in the shed for the same reason.In March the cows which are going to calf first are put out to grass and get extra feeding. In April the old ewes which were tupped first are brought into the fields to lamb.All the ewes that have twins are moved to get more feeding.If the lambing started before April there wouldn't be enough food or grass for them all.
